channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A federal judge dismisses the DOJ's effort to get voter data from California
item.description: The Trump administration has been dealt its first legal setback in its unprecedented effort to consolidate voter data traditionally held by states.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has been dealt its first legal setback in its unprecedented effort to consolidate voter data traditionally held by states.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: The USS Ford crew is struggling with sewage problems on board the Navy's new carrier
item.description: Problems with the plumbing system on board America's newest aircraft carrier are getting worse. Issues with the toilets on the USS Ford continue even as it continues its deployment to the Caribbean.
item.content:encoded: Problems with the plumbing system on board America's newest aircraft carrier are getting worse. Issues with the toilets on the USS Ford continue even as it continues its deployment to the Caribbean.
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: Behind the front lines of the legal battle against Trump's National Guard deployments
item.description: As President Trump began a pattern of deploying the National Guard to democratic-led cities, several Democratic attorneys general and their staffs worked to coordinate their fight against the deployments – and, ultimately, they won.
item.content:encoded:
As President Trump began a pattern of deploying the National Guard to democratic-led cities, several Democratic attorneys general and their staffs worked to coordinate their fight against the deployments – and, ultimately, they won.

(Image credit: David Pashaee)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act (again). What is it?
item.description: As protests grow over violent ICE enforcement actions in Minneapolis, the president said he could invoke a centuries-old law that would give him sweeping powers to deploy the military in U.S. cities.
item.content:encoded:
As protests grow over violent ICE enforcement actions in Minneapolis, the president said he could invoke a centuries-old law that would give him sweeping powers to deploy the military in U.S. cities.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: 24 hours of chaos as mental health grants are slashed then restored
item.description: For 24 hours, it was unclear which mental health and addiction programs would survive and who would still have jobs when the dust settled.
item.content:encoded:
For 24 hours, it was unclear which mental health and addiction programs would survive and who would still have jobs when the dust settled.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: FBI searches WaPo reporter's home. And, Trump restores $2B to public health funds
item.description: The FBI searches the home of a Washington Post reporter as part of a leak investigation. And, the Trump administration restores $2B for mental health and addiction programs.
item.content:encoded:
The FBI searches the home of a Washington Post reporter as part of a leak investigation. And, the Trump administration restores $2B for mental health and addiction programs.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: FBI searches home of Washington Post reporter as part of leak investigation
item.description: The FBI searched the home of a Washington Post reporter who covers the federal government, seizing her laptops, phone and smart watch. The move has alarmed free speech advocates and the media.
item.content:encoded: The FBI searched the home of a Washington Post reporter who covers the federal government, seizing her laptops, phone and smart watch. The move has alarmed free speech advocates and the media.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: More students are going to college. Affordability and workforce training are factors
item.description: Overall enrollment is up slightly at colleges and universities, driven by gains at community colleges and public four-year programs.
item.content:encoded: Overall enrollment is up slightly at colleges and universities, driven by gains at community colleges and public four-year programs.
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The FBI searched a Washington Post reporter's home Wednesday, Denmark says a working group will be formed to address U.S. concerns, Trump administration reverses mental health cuts.
item.content:encoded: The FBI searched a Washington Post reporter's home Wednesday, Denmark says a working group will be formed to address U.S. concerns, Trump administration reverses mental health cuts.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Tensions remain high Minneapolis as anti-ICE protests continue
item.description: Tensions are high in the Twin Cities over ICE's crackdown. A state lawsuit calls the agency's tactics dangerous and unconstitutional while Trump officials say that protestors are the real problem.
item.content:encoded: Tensions are high in the Twin Cities over ICE's crackdown. A state lawsuit calls the agency's tactics dangerous and unconstitutional while Trump officials say that protestors are the real problem.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste
